page.title: 02Ecology of Lansallos coast
page.content: The coastal belt of Lansallos is an A.N.O.B.-Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty- and is therefore protected from disturbance by Statute.The inaccessability of the cliffs,except on foot,mens that only people that appreciate the rugged environment go there so that there is almost no litter or polution.The windy climate and exposed cliffs restricts the type of vegetation and has produced virtual heathland on the upper slopes of the cliffs.The footpaths along the cliffs are part of the Southwest Way,maintained by the National Trust and which go right round the coast of Cornwall.
